entity.name: New Years Eve
entity.description: This entity includes all conversations for New Years Eve for all years.

urls.title: Why 2020 has been good for England's beavers
urls.description: Homes for these "ultimate environmental engineers" have been set up in enclosures across England.

tweets.text:
2020 has been a good year for beavers in England! The canals and dams beavers build alleviate flood risk and create wetlands for other species. 

400 years ago they were hunted to extinction, find out about the successes we've seen in their reintroduction: https://t.co/JSWh5o63Kd

Really good to see mainstream coverage of this by @guardian Have seen & felt the impact #flooding has on people too often. Research on this by @EnvAgency @PHE_uk has in part driven changes to funding allocations to more strongly recognise this aspect. https://t.co/G636oNCZBK

Please read this if you are at risk of being #Flooded and have done nothing about it!

'We don't sleep when it's raining': the mental health impact of flooding https://t.co/CWmXUHSkmy

And @EnvAgency Board Member and Chief Executive of @EsmeeFairbairn Caroline Mason CBE (@LineyMason) has been recognised with a damehood "for services to the Charity Sector, particularly during the COVID-19 response". #TeamEA Huge congratulations to them all. (3/3)

@RosieP4 @EnvAgencySE @AnglianWater @LV8andrea @chrismothman1 @Evansthegrump @MarkAlanCory Does @yourcolchester  even monitor what is going on in this area. Holes have been cut in various places  along this wall and water is getting behind  and compromising the structure https://t.co/ilgo7kodx7

The @EnvAgency  Target for inspecting sewage works in Thames region in 2017 was on average once every EIGHT YEARS. Target 33 achieved 17. Still the leadership cut the monitoring staff. Wondering where it all went wrong? @EmmaHowardBoyd
@shaun_boughton @EnvAgencySE @AnglianWater @LV8andrea @chrismothman1 @Evansthegrump @MarkAlanCory Can I refer to this tweet in my submission to environmental audit committee river quality inquiry ?
If you are making a New Years Resolution, please make it to check your #floodrisk & sign up for a FREE @EnvAgency flood warning! Go on, it'll only take a few minutes & could save a lot of heartbreak!
